text: "July" is a song by American singer Noah Cyrus, released as the lead single from her second EP The End of Everything through Records and Columbia Records on July 31, 2019. A duet version with American soul singer Leon Bridges was released on November 8, 2019, after which the song became Cyrus' second and Bridges' first entry on the US Billboard Hot 100, peaking at number 85. ==Composition== The song features harmonies and "contemplative lyrics" over "simple acoustic instrumentation". ==Critical reception== Mike Wass of Idolator described the track as a "country-tinged ballad". Writing for Billboard, Ellise Shafer called it "reflective" and a "folk-infused ballad" about "the continuous cycle of a toxic relationship". ==Music video== The music video was directed by James Pereira and released on July 31, the same day as the song. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2019–2020) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| Netherlands (Single Tip) | 7 |- ! scope="row"| New Zealand Hot Singles (RMNZ) | 8 |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |} ==Certifications== ==Release history== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" ! scope="row"| Region ! scope="row"| Date ! scope="row"| Format ! scope="row"| Version ! scope="row"| Label ! scope="row"| |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2"| Various | July 31, 2019 | rowspan="2"| | Original | rowspan="4"|Columbia | align="center" | |- | November 8, 2019 | rowspan="2"|Duet | align="center" | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2"| United States | January 20, 2020 | Hot adult contemporary radio | align="center" | |- | January 28, 2020 | Contemporary hit radio | Original | align="center" | |- |} ==References== Category:2010s ballads Category:2019 singles Category:2019 songs Category:Leon Bridges songs Category:Noah Cyrus songs Category:Songs written by Noah Cyrus
title: July (Noah Cyrus song)
